alert.note: Alert for Clay; St. Johns (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 17 at 6:23PM EDT until August 17 at 7:00PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: The National Weather Service in Jacksonville has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Central St. Johns County in northeastern Florida... East central Clay County in northeastern Florida... * Until 700 PM EDT. * At 622 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Nocatee to World Golf Village to near Green Cove Springs, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Green Cove Springs, World Golf Village, South Ponte Vedra, Nocatee, Durbin, Vilano Beach, Picolata, Guana River State Park and Bakersville. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. If on or near the St. Johns River south of Green Cover Springs, get away from the water and move indoors or inside a vehicle. Remember, lightning can strike out to 15 miles from the parent thunderstorm. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Move to safe shelter now! Do not be caught on the water in a thunderstorm. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
